generated.out: Introducing the Parla Sonic 3.5, a smartphone running on Android 4.1 (Jelly Bean) operating system. It features a 3.5-inch TFT display with a resolution of 320 x 480 pixels and a 1.0 GHz Cortex-A5 processor by Spreadtrum SC7710G. The device comes with 512MB of RAM and 512MB of internal storage, expandable via a dedicated microSDHC card slot. The main camera is a 2-megapixel sensor with the ability to capture videos at 480p resolution, while the selfie camera is not present. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, FM radio, and microUSB 2.0. The device is powered by a removable Li-Ion 1300 mAh battery, which provides up to 16 hours of talk time on 2G and up to 6 hours on 3G. The Parla Sonic 3.5 supports dual SIM cards (Mini-SIM) and is available in black and white color options.

generated.out: The Karbonn Titanium Hexa boasts a 5.5-inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1080x1920 pixels, resulting in a screen-to-body ratio of approximately 70.5%. This dual SIM smartphone runs on Android 4.4.2 (KitKat) and is powered by a Mediatek MT6591 chipset with a hexa-core 1.5 GHz Cortex-A7 CPU and Mali-450MP4 GPU. It comes with 16GB of internal storage and 2GB of RAM, which can be expanded via a microSDHC card. The primary camera is a 13-megapixel autofocus lens with LED flash and panorama capabilities, while the secondary camera is a 5-megapixel lens. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.0, A2DP, GPS, and microUSB 2.0 with OTG support. The device is equipped with an accelerometer and proximity sensor, and its 2050mAh Li-Po battery provides power. The Titanium Hexa is available in black and white color options and was released in April 2014, with the status now being discontinued.

generated.out: The QMobile E1 is a smartphone that boasts a 5.0-inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 720 x 1280 pixels. It runs on Android 6.0 (Marshmallow) and is powered by a Mediatek MT6735P chipset with a quad-core 1.0 GHz Cortex-A53 CPU and Mali-T720MP2 GPU. The device comes with 3GB RAM and 16GB internal storage, which can be expanded via a microSDXC card. The primary camera is an 8-megapixel autofocus lens with an aperture of f/2.2, while the front-facing camera is a 5-megapixel lens with an aperture of f/2.4. The E1 supports 4G LTE connectivity with bands 3 and 5, as well as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, and FM radio. It also features a 3.5mm headphone jack and a microUSB 2.0 port. The device is equipped with a removable Li-Po 4000 mAh battery and is available in black and gold color options. The QMobile E1 was announced in January 2017 and was released around the same time. It is now discontinued.
